item.title: Laura add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Laura add a quote by Philip Yancey
item.description: "Christians are not perfect, by any means, but they can be people made fully alive." -- Philip Yancey

item.title: Laura add a quote by Philip Yancey
item.description: "We admit that we will never reach our ideal in this life, a distinctive the church claims that most other human institutions try to deny." -- Philip Yancey

item.title: Laura add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Laura add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "People who read your ideas tend to think that your writings reflect your life." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Laura add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Great balls of fire. Don't bother me anymore, and don't call me sugar." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "In a weak moment, I have written a book." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I was never one to patiently pick up broken fragments and glue them together again and tell myself that the mended whole was as good as new. What is broken is broken - and I'd rather remember it as it was at its best than mend it and see the broken places as long as I lived. " -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "With enough courage, you can do without a reputation." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Laura add a quote by Donald McCaig
item.description: "Patriotic'? Dear, dear me!" Scarlett covered her mouth in mock astonishment. "I didn't know that was 'patriotism.' I believe what you intended has ruder names, though no well-bred Georgia lady would admit to knowing them." -- Donald McCaig

item.title: Laura add a quote by Donald McCaig
item.description: "I'm afraid, Belle, that being a lady is more than proper clothes. It is an attitude. From your...experience, you may know more of business and politics than ladies are supposed to know. Gentlemen are pleased to think ladies are ornamental, and it is an ill-advised ornament who contradicts her gentleman." -- Donald McCaig

item.title: Laura add a quote by Donald McCaig
item.description: "You'll want to read books - novels, because ladies are frivolous; poetry because ladies are sentimental; and sermons, because we are pious. If you must read essays, Mr. Emerson might be best. Your gentleman may have a nodding acquaintance with his works." -- Donald McCaig

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Now I wept: Helen Burns was not here; nothing sustained me; left to myself I abandoned myself, and my tears watered the boards." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Laura add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "It is in vain to say human beings ought to be satisfied with tranquility: they must have action; and they will make it if they cannot find it." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Laura add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Laura add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "What do girls do who haven't any mothers to help them through their troubles?" -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Laura add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Laura add a quote by Jose Saramgo
item.description: "This is the effect of panic, a natural effect, you could say that animal nature is like this, plant life would behave in exactly the same way, too, if it did not have all those roots to hold it in the ground, and how nice it would be to see the trees of the forest fleeing the flames." -- Jose Saramgo

item.title: Laura add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Laura add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have no faith in human perfectibility. I think that human exertion will have no appreciable effect upon humanity. Man is now only more active - not more happy - nor more wise, than he was 6000 years ago." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Laura add a quote by Philip Yancey
item.description: "We tend to think, 'Life should be fair because God is fair.' But God is not life. And if I confuse God with the physical reality of life- by expecting constant good health for example- then I set myself up for crashing disappointment." -- Philip Yancey

item.title: Laura add a quote by Celia Rivenbark
item.description:
"<i>[Home Economics Textbook from 1950]</i>: "Prepare yourself. Take fifteen minutes to rest so you'll look refreshed when hubby comes home from work. Touch up makeup and put a ribbon in your hair. He's just been with work-weary people. Be a little gay. His boring day needs a lift."
<i>Mama Celia</i>: "Get knee-walking drunk. You've earned it. You've been with four kids under the age of seven all day. Put a ribbon in your nose and try to pull it out of your mouth. You're wasted, after all. Announce you're gay. The look on his face will give you a lift." -- Celia Rivenbark

item.title: Laura add a quote by Celia Rivenbark
item.description:
"I really loathe [the bumper sticker] 'Proud Parent of a Terrific Kid!'
Why not a bumper sticker for the unlucky parents, something like: 'My Fifteen-Year-Old's in Detox and Not Speaking to Any of Us' or 'My Kid Robbed a 7-Eleven and is in a Center for Youthful Offenders." -- Celia Rivenbark

item.title: Laura add a quote by Celia Rivenbark
item.description:
"Severe isn't a word normally associated with a cold. Severe is for weather or third-degree burns...No one responds 'severe' when someone asks how her cold is.
In fact, nine out of ten Americans respond to 'How's your cold' with 'It sucks.' So there should be an It Sucks cold formula." -- Celia Rivenbark

item.title: Laura add a quote by Lisa Samson
item.description: "My breath caught in wonder and surprise and I remembered that during the darkest of hours, God is. " -- Lisa Samson

item.title: Laura add a quote by Lisa Samson
item.description: "Although I doubt He [Jesus] said "believeth" as He was Jewish and not a fancy-pants English fellow." -- Lisa Samson

item.title: Laura add a quote by Lisa Samson
item.description: "I've met the folk that have the perfect garlands and sprays and wreaths, the folk that live in Williamsburg-style houses. And I've met the folk that live at the edge of town in two-bedroom ranch houses that have Frosty the Snowman, lights playing tag around the roof, and a Rudolph stuck askew somewhere on the lawn. I'd rather sit in the home of the atter with and errant couch spring poking my derriere because, truthfully, they're glad to have me, and they never look at my shoes and wonder where I'd been before I got there. " -- Lisa Samson

item.title: Laura add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "I'm not saying we shouldn't grieve. Just, why don't we put it in God's hands? she said. Why haven't we learned this, after all the evidence of all the dead? We're supposed to believe in God but then why don't we obey the laws of God's universe, which teach us how small we are and where we're all going to end up?" -- Don DeLillo
